did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: First Presbyterian Church of Romulus records, 1802-1824.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: First Presbyterian Church of Romulus, (Romulus, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Photocopy of the first record book of the church which contains membership information, session meeting minutes, the church covenant, and Articles of Faith.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Organized in 1802 by Jedediah Chapman, a famous itinerant minister, and incorporated in 1807, the church came under the Geneva Presbytery on September 17, 1805. A church was built in 1808-1809 with a new building in 1838.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This volume is a photocopy of the first record book of the church, which contains membership information, session meeting minutes, the church covenant, and Articles of Faith (1808-1824).

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: First Presbyterian Church of Romulus, (Romulus, N.Y.)

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: First Presbyterian Church of Romulus records, #6008. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Records of the First Presbyterian Church

scopecontent.p: Of the Town of Romulus, in the County of Seneca, & State of New York, Constituted April 4th 1802.

did.unittitle: Front inside cover lists marriages from 1815-1817.
names of children who can recite the shorter catechism.

scopecontent.p: Minutes of the session meetings which were attended by the pastor and the church elders. Minutes deal with church discipline, examination of prospective members, acceptance of new members, suspension of members, call to a member to become a minister, baptism, and the election of deacons and sextons. The minutes report that there were no records from November 23, 1804 to January 23, l806.

did.unittitle: 8 page list of members and their baptized children
